topics.body:
Serious question:
It's about what I want to do with my video game; it's still in on paper only cause it's in the "make sure it won't break when I put it together" phase, but that's another story.


Anyways my idea that I was saying earlier is make a short 20-30 minute video game over the next two years, a realistic goal, but my idea is not only make it mod friendly but have it to where other companies are for a licensing fee allowed to build their games off top of it.  What I mean by this is that have my game essentially and if another company wants to they can build off top of it for profit.


Do you think this could work?  Cause it could save companies a lot of money if they just built their games off top off mine.



You know how call of duty all their games are simply rehashes of the previous game?  What that would essentially do is allow other companies do that as well.  Obviously if it's successful there's going to be companies that abuse this and simply make their games a retexture of mine, but people already do that anyhow in the industry anyhow where their current game is simply a rehash of their older games.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53af94be63687255641a0200#post_53af94be63687255641a0200
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53af93256368725400830100#post_53af93256368725400830100
Why not make a Derpibooru fighting game with members as characters?

[/bq]
Copyright reasons and besides I already have the story planned out.

Massive spoiler, but it's not going to be completed for another two years so whatever:
[spoiler]The basic story is that it's a pseudo religious story in that the background is that the devil is the main villain, but not in the traditional sense.  The devil is created by the god of the story(not a specific religion's god; side note: all the characters are female) and that her fall is because she loves god too much and as a result sees how much shit her mom gets for things she never did and tries to get rid of humans not cause she wants to take over anything, but because she sees how much people hurt her mom and wants them to stop hurting her and is willing to do anything and go to any extent to do so which starts the story.  The story starts in that she just goes apeshit after someone almost kills her mom and starts a infection that is essentially zombies(specifically regenerative, smart, slow, spitters that hocking a loogey at people is how they infect you[just take a huge spit and spit disease infected booger in your face]).

Call it a cop out, but I honestly want to keep the rating as low as possible by instead of using guns using magic and such.  The other cop out is that at the end the cure doesn't necessarily 100% cure people rather gives them back their mind and makes them no longer able to infect people so I can go "Oh no one actually died" cause if everyone that dies just constantly regenerates and at the end of the story they come back anyhow when the ESRB tries rating it I can just go, "No one died so can't give me a M rating LoL".[/spoiler]
Basically the story in a nutshell is someone tries to hurt the antagonist's family so the antagonist goes apeshit after seeing their mom almost die before their eyes and she never intended for the fallout of their actions to get that bad.  Less of a pure evil antagonist and more of a "I dun fucked up!  I really dun fucked up!" antagonist that makes one split second bad decision that spirals out of control.

topics.body: So I was watching Pacific Rim for the 6th time this week and I noticed something that was kind of really awesome. Throughout the entire movie, none of the characters referred Gipsy Danger as "it". It was always female pronouns. It was always "she" or "her" and I really liked that little touch.
